The Prussian Cultural Heritage Foundation confirmed that Parzinger had received a letter from Zahi Hawass , but said that it was not signed by the prime minister and was not an official demand from the Egyptian state. It added that under a 1912 agreement, artefacts found in the dig were properly listed and photographed, showing clearly their "beauty and quality", and then divided up between the two sides.
